forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Sunny then Slight Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers between noon and 2pm. Partly sunny. High near 40, with temperatures falling to around 34 in the afternoon. North wind 12 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 25. Northwest wind 3 to 7 mph.

weather_report:
The morning in Boston unfolds beneath a canvas of shifting clouds, hinting at the intricacies of a winter day. A gentle breeze stirs, carrying the crisp chill characteristic of this season, while the sun plays a subtle game of hide and seek between patches of gray and blue. Currently, the air hangs at just around 40 degrees, perhaps feeling brisker as it dips into the mid-thirties later on. Today holds the potential for a fleeting shower around midday, but such is the nature of these winter months—a whisper of moisture amidst a predominantly dry atmosphere.

As evening approaches, it promises to cloak the city in a veil of clouds, with temperatures sinking to a frosty 25 degrees. When venturing outdoors, warmth will be your ally; layering is advised—think a robust coat over a soft sweater, complemented by a snug hat and gloves. For those looking to embrace the day, a leisurely stroll through the park or a quaint café visit to enjoy something warm and comforting could be the perfect antidote to the chilly air. Perhaps a stop by a local bookstore, where the scent of coffee mingles with the pages of new adventures, would also gracefully punctuate the closing hours of the day.
